H0.text: Decomposing dead organisms are the source of energy for mushrooms.

H1.text: Killing organisms is how mushrooms get their energy.

H2.text: Accumulating dead organisms is how mushrooms get their energy.

H3.text: Producing dead organisms is where mushrooms get their energy.

A4.text: One of the primary roles of fungi in an ecosystem is to decompose organic compounds.

A5.text: Petroleum products and some pesticides (typical soil contaminants) are organic molecules (i.e., they are built on a carbon structure), and thereby show a potential carbon source for fungi.
